Package level

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • level.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer
    Defines the level class, which contains all the information about a level.
    Author:
    psyjpf

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(MyStage base, GenerateLevel LevelToMake, java.lang.Integer Lives)
      Constructs a new level, adds in the player and begins the music and timers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int calculateFinalScore()
      Generates the final score
      void checkEnd()
      Checks if the player has won the game and if so launch winning screen and return to main menu.
      void checkGameOver()
      Checks if the player has ran out of lives and hit game over!
      private void generateHeartsOverlay​(java.lang.Integer Lives)
      Generates the hearts to represent number of lives.
      Player getFrog()  
      private void hideHearts()
      Updates the hearts on the screen to the player to see how many lives left.
      void update()
      Implements the observer pattern, instead of pooling and checking every frame for a change in the players score we now let the player tell us when the score has changed and in doing so if they have one the game or if they have lost it.
      private void updateScore()
      Updates the score on the screen to the player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(MyStage base,
            GenerateLevel LevelToMake,
            java.lang.Integer Lives)
        Constructs a new level, adds in the player and begins the music and timers.
        Parameters:
        base - Keeps an aggregate pointer to the parent container to draw too
        LevelToMake - Says what level you want to generate
        Lives - The number of lives the player has in this game

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Implements the observer pattern, instead of pooling and checking every frame for a change in the players score we now let the player tell us when the score has changed and in doing so if they have one the game or if they have lost it.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer

      • generateHeartsOverlay

        private void generateHeartsOverlay​(java.lang.Integer Lives)
        Generates the hearts to represent number of lives.
        Parameters:
        Lives - the number of lives the player has.

      • updateScore

        private void updateScore()
        Updates the score on the screen to the player.

      • hideHearts

        private void hideHearts()
        Updates the hearts on the screen to the player to see how many lives left.

      • calculateFinalScore

        public int calculateFinalScore()
        Generates the final score
        Returns:
        The points earned in the game plus the number of lives remaining * 15

      • checkEnd

        public void checkEnd()
        Checks if the player has won the game and if so launch winning screen and return to main menu.

      • checkGameOver

        public void checkGameOver()
        Checks if the player has ran out of lives and hit game over!

      • getFrog

        public Player getFrog()
        Returns:
        The player on the level, used only for unit testing.
